abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives for the
            Financial Decentralization and Accountability Project are:
            1) implementing a sustainable process of self-management in
            financial administration while instituting sound financial
            management standards and systems in a critical mass of
            public entities; and 2) building up a strong public auditing
            function able to collaborate with private sector auditing
            firms to continuously review and evaluate financial
            performance and integrity of operations conducted by public
            sector entities. The project's components are: 1)
            implementing decentralized integrated financial management
            systems (IFMS), developing institutional capacity to improve
            project auditing, accounting, and reporting;  2) IFMS public
            sector-wide integration through installing telecom links,
            linking both the decentralized and centralized financial and
            budget reporting systems; 3) modernizing the budget
            transactions payments systems via a private sector banking
            network; 4) disseminating integrated financial management
            operations and implementing public financial regulations; 5)
            project operating costs covering administrative and project
            management staff, travel, materials, and equipment; 6)
            strengthening government auditing and decentralized sector
            evaluations; 7) implementing audit capability for
            operational and special audits; 8) anti-corruption auditing
            techniques and public sector ethics dissemination; 9)
            training in accounting, auditing, and financial management;
            and 10) contingencies and project preparation facilities refinancing.
